page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: This is a rural area of beautiful,undulating countryside surrounding attractive valleys built mainly of local stone. The valleys are inhabited by a mixture of villagers who have lived there all their lives and people who live in Corby.There is some new development in each village,but mainly people have bought and renovated old cottages.The land cover is mainly arable farming of wheat and a lot of oil seed rape this year. East Carlton Hall and its Country Park dominate the area.This is heavily wooded and is being developed as a large recreational area for families. There are many splendid views over the rolling hunting country with small woods and spinneys adding to the richness of the landscape.
